name: FTP
description: The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is a standard network protocol used to transfer computer files between a client and server on a computer network

Establish Connection.val: Connects to the specified FTP server
Displays the current status of FTP connections
Specifes a user to the remote computer

Download.val: Copies a single remote file to the local computer
Copies one or more remote files to the local computer
Copies a remote file to the local computer

Upload.val: Copies a single local file to the remote computer
Copies one or more local files to the remote computer
Copies a local file to the remote computer (same as “put”)
Appends a local file to a file on the remote computer

Toggle Transfer Type.val: Sets the file transfer type to ASCII, the default
Sets the file transfer type to binary
Sets or displays the file transfer type (default = ASCII)

Navigate On Remote.val: Displays an abbreviated list of a remote directory’s files and subdirectories
Displays a list of a remote directory’s files and subdirectories
Displays the current directory on the remote computer (literally, “print working directory”)
Changes the working directory on the remote computer
Displays a list of a remote directory’s files and subdirectories
Displays an abbreviated list of a remote directory’s files and subdirectories

Delete On Remote.val: Deletes a single file on a remote computer
Deletes one or more files on a remote computer

Local.val: Runs the specified command on the local computer
Changes the working directory on the local computer

Misc Settings.val: Toggles hash sign (#) printing for each data block transferred (default = OFF)
Toggles a bell to ring after each file transfer command is completed (default = OFF)

Close Connection.val: Ends the FTP session and exits ftp
Ends the FTP session with the remote computer and exits ftp (same as “bye”)
Ends the FTP session and returns to the command interpreter
Disconnects from the remote computer, retaining the ftp prompt

Command Line Options.val: Suppresses verbose display of remote server responses
Turns off interactive prompting during multiple file transfers
Enables debugging, displaying all ftp commands passed between the client and server
Disables filename globbing, which permits the use of wildcard chracters in local file and path names
Specifies a text file containing ftp commands; the commands will automatically run after ftp starts. No spaces are allowed in this parameter. Use this switch instead of redirection (>)
Use any local interface when binding data connection
Overrides the default transfer buffer size of 4096
Specifies the computer name or IP address of the remote computer to connect to. The computer, if specified, must be the last parameter on the line
